body:
On Saturday 19 May 2007 08:38 pm, Elizabeth Stark wrote:
> > > I would suggest building into your plan somehow the "beyond music"
> >
> > strategy
> >
> > > of the Chinese, so artists using your site don't expect to make money
> >
> > from
> >
> > > the fans for the music directly.  There should be something else,
> > > merchandising or signed pictures or whatever.
> >
> > That is one option, but I think setting a price at which you will release
> > a
> > track with a Free license (say CC BY-SA for the sake of argument) is
> > worth an
> > experiment. If I can get some people together willing to record this way,
> > I
> > will run some experiments along these lines.
>
> FYI, Antenna Alliance, a CC recording project out of Boston, MA and
> expanding to other cities is recording bands free of cost and promoting the
> music to college radio stations in exchange for releasing the music under
> CC licenses. (They are very heavily promoting  CC BY and BY-SA and as a
> result, most, but not all of the music is under those licenses).

Thank you so much for the info. Do you know if they have any funding ideas / 
experiments going on? I would be happy to throw ideas around along those 
lines.
>
> The site is still in the works, but you can find out more info at
> www.antalliance.org.

all the best,
